name: Bracket strategically
summary: Use ranges (brackets) to guide the midpoint toward your target while preserving flexibility and reducing confrontation.
goal: Improve outcomes by shaping expectations without committing to a single point too early.
counterparty_guidance: Do not split the difference automatically; ask which end is real.
Counter with your own bracket or a single number tied to criteria.
Use the range to surface priorities, then narrow the scope.
Avoid anchoring inside a range that disadvantages you.

when_to_use: Use when you need a structured move to progress the negotiation.
when_not_to_use: Avoid when facts are missing and you need intake/clarification first.

prerequisites.remediation: Fill target/acceptable/walk-away in the Strategy Canvas.

inputs.label: Range low end
inputs.help: Lower end of the range you present.

inputs.label: Range high end
inputs.help: Upper end of the range you present.

inputs.label: What midpoint you want
inputs.help: Optional: what you want the midpoint to land on.

steps.title: Validate context and prerequisites
steps.instruction: Validate prerequisites, restate the intended move, and identify missing info that would improve execution.
steps.notes: If blockers exist, return remediation instead of artifacts.

steps.title: Execute the strategy
steps.instruction: Generate the required artifacts (drafts, packages, checklist) and run critique rubrics before presenting to the user.

branches.label: They try to accept only the low end

recommended_move.instruction: Clarify that the range indicates a zone for discussion, then ask which objective criteria they are using to justify choosing the low end.

branches.risk_notes: Avoid arguing; move to criteria and trade-offs.

success_criteria: Move is explicit and progresses the negotiation.
Message includes a next step or calibrated question.
failure_modes: Unnecessary disclosure of urgency or bottom line.
do_not_do: Do not reveal your bottom line unless intentionally walking away.

auto_gates.description: Warn or block if explicit bottom line language is present.
